There are $n$ hotels ($2 \le n \le 100000$) connected by $n-1$ roads.  You can travel between any two hotels by following these roads, and it takes 1 unit of time to travel between hotels connected by a road.

The organizers want to choose 2 hotels to be the "main hotels".  They want to know the minimum amount of time it takes for all participants to travel to one of the main hotels, where each participant goes to the nearest main hotel.

Input:

* The first line contains the number of hotels, $n$.
* The next $n-1$ lines each contain two numbers, representing a road between those two hotels.
* The next line contains the number of queries, $m$.
* The following $m$ lines each contain two numbers, representing the two hotels that will be the main hotels for that query.

Output:

For each query, print the minimum time it takes for all participants to reach a main hotel.

You are given a network of connected cities.  Find the minimum time it takes for all people to reach two designated cities, given that each person travels to the closest designated city and travel between cities takes one unit of time.
